content.description: Three common methods of beef production include using rangelands, pasture, and feedlots. The environmental impacts of these different methods for a variety of variables is compared in the graph below.
content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the data in the graph?

choices.label: Raising beef on rangelands has the greatest environmental impact as a result of methane emissions and high levels of pesticide contamination.
Switching from raising beef on pastures to raising beef in feedlots decreases the total energy consumption and the rate of soil erosion as a result of an increase in vegetation in feedlots.
Feedlots have high levels of pesticide use and energy consumption as a result high demands for grain production.
Greenhouse gas emissions are equal across all beef production methods because all cattle produce methane gas and carbon dioxide.

content.answer: Feedlots have high levels of pesticide use and energy consumption as a result high demands for grain production.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
